sen.j: 下襲（したがさね）とは、束帯及び衣冠装束のとき袍と半臂の間に着る衣服。
sen.e: The term "shitagasane" refers to an inner robe which is put on between ho (outer robe/vestment) and hanpi (sleeveless body wear) when wearers put on a sokutai (traditional ceremonial court dress) or an ikan shozoku (traditional formal court dress).
sen.cmt: 原文で「和服用語集」となっていた箇所をWebで確認すると「袍(ほう)」でしたので、原文を訂正し、この用語で登録されている訳語を充てています。/衣冠装束: 定訳不明。用語集には「ikan costume」と登録されていますが、これでは「ikan」の意味が不明なので、「衣冠」として登録されている訳語を充てています(「装束」の意味は、訳語の「dress」と重複するため、訳出しておりません)。
sen.e: The term "shitagasane" refers to an inner robe which is put on between ho (outer robe/vestment) and hanpi (sleeveless body wear) when wearers put on a sokutai (traditional ceremonial court dress) or an ikan shozoku (traditional formal court dress).

The term "shitagasane" refers to an inner robe which is put on between ho (outer robe/vestment) and hanpi (sleeveless body wear) when wearers put on a sokutai (traditional ceremonial court dress) or an ikan shozoku (traditional formal court dress).

sen.j: 表地を冬は綾か平絹、夏は紗などで仕立てた。
sen.e: While the right side was made of aya (twilled silk) or hiraginu (plain silk) for winter wear, it was made of sha (silk gauze), etc. for summer wear.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/綾: 用語集には「aya (twill weave, pattern of diagonal stripes)」と「aya (twilled silk)」が登録されていますが、ここでは材質が問われていますので、後者を採用しています。
sen.e: While the right side was made of aya (twilled silk) or hiraginu (plain silk) for winter wear, it was made of sha (silk gauze), and the like for summer wear.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処OKetc → and the like
sen.e: While the right side was made of aya (twilled silk) or hiraginu (plain silk) for winter wear, it was made of sha (silk gauze), and the like for summer wear.

sen.j: 裏地を平絹などを板引加工したもので作った。
sen.e: The reverse side was made of a cloth such as hiraginu which was lustered by itabiki (a luster method for silk).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/板引加工: 定訳不明。「絹布のつや出し加工の手法」(http://kotobank.jp/word/%E6%9D%BF%E5%BC%95%E3%81%8D)を指します。用語集では「板引」は「itabiki」と登録されていますが、これでは意味が不明なので、カッコ内に説明を補っています。
sen.e: The reverse side was made of a cloth such as hiraginu which was lustered by itabiki (a luster method for silk).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処OK
sen.e: The reverse side was made of a cloth such as hiraginu which was lustered by itabiki (a luster method for silk).

sen.j: 身頃は二巾である。
sen.e: Its migoro (the main section) is made of two pieces of cloth.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/身頃: 用語集の「Migoro (front and back of kimono excepting the 'eri' (collar), 'sode' (sleeves), and 'okumi' (front)」は、「front and back」と最初に規定しているのに、「えり、そで、おくみ (front)」を除く」という除外の記述中に「front」があり、矛盾している印象を受けるため、プログレッシブ和英中辞典第3版(「kotobank」の英和・和英検索)の「the main section(s) of a kimono [dress]」を基にして訳しています。/二巾: 「巾」には「布切れ」の意味があるため、ここでは「2枚の布」という意味と解釈して訳しています。
sen.e: Its migoro (the main section) is made of two pieces of cloth.
Its migoro (the main section) is made of two pieces of cloth.

sen.j: 襟は打ち合わせのあるものである。
sen.e: Its collar is partially overlapped with itself.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Its collar is partially overlapped with itself.
Its collar is partially overlapped with itself.

sen.j: 脇は縫われていない。
sen.e: Its sides are unstitched.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Its sides are unstitched.
Its sides are unstitched.

sen.j: 後身頃の裾を長く仕立てている（続裾）。
sen.e: The hem of its back part is made long, and is called tsuzukikyo (long hem).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/後身頃: 用語集には「back main panel」と登録されていますが、このフレーズと「ushiromigoro」、または、このフレーズと「後身頃」の組み合わせ等でGoogle検索しても1件もヒットしませんので、プログレッシブ和英中辞典第3版の「後ろ身頃: the back part of a kimono」を基にして訳出しています。
sen.e: The hem of its back part is made long, and is called tsuzukikyo (long hem).
The hem of its back part is made long, and is called tsuzukikyo (long hem).

sen.j: この裾は身分差などを表現するようになって極端に長くなった。
sen.e: This hem had been made extremely long since it came to be used to show class differences, etc.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This hem had been made extremely long since it came to be used to show class differences, and the like.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処OKetc → and the like
sen.e: This hem had been made extremely long since it came to be used to show class differences, and the like.

sen.j: 邪魔にならないように別仕立て（別裾）にするようになった。
sen.e: It came to be made separately (separated hem) so that it would not hinder wearers from moving.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/別裾: 定訳不明
sen.e: It came to be made separately (separated hem) so that it would not hinder wearers from moving.
It came to be made separately (separated hem) so that it would not hinder wearers from moving.

sen.j: 行幸などで屋外で活動する際には、石帯に下襲の裾を挟んで邪魔にならないようにしていた。
sen.e: While wearers were taking part in an outdoor activity, for example, on an imperial visit, its hem was put behind the sekitai, a leather belt, so that it would not hinder them from moving.
sen.cmt: 石帯: 用語集には2つの訳語が登録されていますが、革製の帯(http://www.excite.co.jp/dictionary/japanese/?search=%E7%9F%B3%E5%B8%AF&match=beginswith&itemid=11237800)であることから、「sekitai, a leather belt」と訳しています。
sen.e: While wearers were taking part in an outdoor activity, for example, on an imperial visit, its hem was put behind the sekitai, a leather belt, so that it would not hinder them from moving.
While wearers were taking part in an outdoor activity, for example, on an imperial visit, its hem was put behind the sekitai, a leather belt, so that it would not hinder them from moving.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代には臣下は皆別裾になった。
sen.e: All vassals came to put on a shitagasane with a separated hem in the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: All vassals came to put on a shitagasane with a separated hem in the Kamakura period.
All vassals came to put on a shitagasane with a separated hem in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: ただ天皇と皇太子のみは昔ながらの続裾を用いる。
sen.e: But only an emperor and a crown prince put on a shitagasane with an old-style tsuzukikyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: But only an emperor and a crown prince put on a shitagasane with an old-style tsuzukikyo.
But only an emperor and a crown prince put on a shitagasane with an old-style tsuzukikyo.

sen.j: 通常、束帯装束か衣冠装束の時のみ着るものである。
sen.e: It was usually put on only when wearers put on a sokutai shozoku (traditional ceremonial court dress).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/束帯装束: 用語集には「sokutai costume」と登録されていますが、これでは「sokutai」の意味が不明なので、「束帯」として登録されている訳語を充てています(「装束」の意味は訳語の「dress」と重複するため、訳出しておりません)。
sen.e: It was usually put on only when wearers put on a sokutai shozoku (traditional ceremonial court dress).
It was usually put on only when wearers put on a sokutai shozoku (traditional ceremonial court dress).

sen.j: だが、摂関期には若い皇族男子のみ「大君姿」と称して直衣装束に下襲を重ねることがあった。
sen.e: However, in the regents and chancellors period, there was a time when only young male members of the imperial family put on a shitagasane on noshi shozoku (everyday clothes for nobles), which was referred to as 'okimisugata style' (relaxed style with everyday clothes for an emperor or an imperial prince).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 / 直衣装束: 定訳不明。「直衣」として登録されている訳語を充てています(「装束」の意味は「clothes」と重複するため、訳出しておりません)。/大君姿: 定訳不明。用語統一リストに従い、用語集の訳語をハイフンなしの表記に直し、さらに、この訳語には説明がありませんので、サイト「http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%A4%A7%E5%90%9B%E5%A7%BF」を参考にした説明をカッコ内に補っています。
sen.e: However, in the regents and chancellors period, there was a time when only young male members of the imperial family put on a shitagasane on noshi shozoku (everyday clothes for nobles), which was referred to as 'okimisugata style' (relaxed style with everyday clothes for an emperor or an imperial prince).

However, in the regents and chancellors period, there was a time when only young male members of the imperial family put on a shitagasane on noshi shozoku (everyday clothes for nobles), which was referred to as 'okimisugata style' (relaxed style with everyday clothes for an emperor or an imperial prince).

sen.j: 躑躅：表が白で裏が濃蘇芳（黒紅色）後に裏が黒。
sen.e: Tsutsuji (azalea): While the right side is white, the reverse side was originally dark suo (deep dark red), but later it has been changed to black.
Tsutsuji (azalea): While the right side is white, the reverse side was originally dark suo (deep dark red), but later it has been changed to black.
Tsutsuji (azalea): While the right side is white, the reverse side was originally dark suo (deep dark red), but later it has been changed to black.

sen.j: 若年者や壮年者が通常用いたもの。
sen.e: It was usually used by persons in young and middle ages.
It was usually used by persons in young and middle ages.
It was usually used by persons in young and middle ages.

sen.j: 柳：表が白で裏が青（現在の緑色）。
sen.e: Yanagi (willow tree): While the right side is white, the reverse side is ao (present-day green).
Yanagi (willow tree): While the right side is white, the reverse side is ao (present-day green).
Yanagi (willow tree): While the right side is white, the reverse side is ao (present-day green).

sen.j: 老年者が通常用いたもの。
sen.e: It was usually used by persons in old age.
It was usually used by persons in old age.
It was usually used by persons in old age.

sen.j: 紅梅：表が紅梅色（濃いピンク）で裏が蘇芳（濃い赤紫）。
sen.e: Kobai (rose plum): While the right side is kobai (dark pink), the reverse side is suo (dark reddish purple).
sen.cmt: 蘇芳（濃い赤紫): 既出の「濃蘇芳」は「黒紅色」とされているため、矛盾しますが、指示書通り、原文通りに訳しております。
sen.e: Kobai (rose plum): While the right side is kobai (dark pink), the reverse side is suo (dark reddish purple).
Kobai (rose plum): While the right side is kobai (dark pink), the reverse side is suo (dark reddish purple).

sen.j: 冬から春の中ごろまで着用でき、正月行事などに用いたもの。
sen.e: It could be put on from the winter to the middle of the spring, and was used for events of the New Year, etc.
It could be put on from the winter to the middle of the spring, and was used for events of the New Year, and so on.
It could be put on from the winter to the middle of the spring, and was used for events of the New Year, and so on.

sen.j: 松重：表が青（緑色）で裏が紫。
sen.e: Matsugasane (pine tree layers): While the right side is ao (present-day green), the reverse side is purple.
sen.cmt: 松重: 用語集には「matsushige」と登録されていますが、「まつがさね」(http://kotobank.jp/word/%E6%9D%BE%E9%87%8D)です。定訳は不明ですが、サイト「http://www.clotheslinejournal.com/heian.html」の説明をカッコ内に補っています。
sen.e: Matsugasane (pine tree layers): While the right side is ao (present-day green), the reverse side is purple.
Matsugasane (pine tree layers): While the right side is ao (present-day green), the reverse side is purple.

sen.j: 天皇や皇族の供をする時や競馬などに用いたもの。
sen.e: It was used to attend an emperor and members of the imperial family or to hold a Kurabeuma (horse racing).
It was used to attend an emperor and members of the imperial family or to hold a Kurabeuma (horse racing).
It was used to attend an emperor and members of the imperial family or to hold a Kurabeuma (horse racing).

sen.j: 黄紅葉：表が黄で裏が蘇芳。
sen.e: Kimomiji (yellow autumn leaves): While the right side is yellow, the reverse side is suo.
Kimomiji (yellow autumn leaves): While the right side is yellow, the reverse side is suo.
Kimomiji (yellow autumn leaves): While the right side is yellow, the reverse side is suo.

sen.j: 九月から十一月まで着用でき、儀式や宴などの晴れの席に用いたもの。
sen.e: It could be put on from September to November, and was used on formal occasions such as a ceremony, a feast, etc.
It could be put on from September to November, and was used on formal occasions such as a ceremony, a feast, or the like.
It could be put on from September to November, and was used on formal occasions such as a ceremony, a feast, or the like.

sen.j: 菊：表が白で裏が蘇芳。
sen.e: Kiku (chrysanthemum): While the right side is white, the reverse side is suo.
Kiku (chrysanthemum): While the right side is white, the reverse side is suo.
Kiku (chrysanthemum): While the right side is white, the reverse side is suo.

sen.j: 十月から十一月まで着用でき、晴れの席に用いる。
sen.e: It could be put on from October to November, and was used on formal occasions.
It could be put on from October to November, and was used on formal occasions.
It could be put on from October to November, and was used on formal occasions.

sen.j: 裏山吹：表が黄で裏が紅。
sen.e: Urayamabuki (a Japanese rose seen from the underside): While the right side is yellow, the reverse side is deep red.
sen.cmt: 裏山吹: 定訳不明。用語集には「ura-yamabuki (golden yellow inside)」と登録されていますが、用語統一リストに従い、ハイフンなしの「Urayamabuki」とし、また、「裏から見た山吹の花を表したもの」(http://www.mode-japonesque.com/mj/kasane/shiki/spring/urayamabuki.htm)という意味ですので、カッコ内にその意味の説明を補っています。
sen.e: Urayamabuki (a Japanese rose seen from the underside): While the right side is yellow, the reverse side is deep red.
Urayamabuki (a Japanese rose seen from the underside): While the right side is yellow, the reverse side is deep red.

sen.j: 冬から春まで着用でき、御賀や行幸などに用いる。
sen.e: It could be put on from the winter to the spring, and was used on imperial festivities, imperial visits, etc.
sen.cmt: 御賀: 定訳不明。「天皇または天皇家の祝事」等を指すと推測されますので(http://books.google.com/books?id=cXj4ki6KxPIC&pg=PA60&dq=%E5%A4%A9%E7%9A%87+%E5%BE%A1%E8%B3%80&lr=lang_ja&as_drrb_is=q&as_minm_is=0&as_miny_is=&as_maxm_is=0&as_maxy_is=&as_brr=3&hl=ja&cd=6#v=onepage&q=%E5%A4%A9%E7%9A%87%20%E5%BE%A1%E8%B3%80&f=false)、「imperial festivities」と訳しています。
sen.e: It could be put on from the winter to the spring, and was used on imperial festivities, imperial visits, and so on.
It could be put on from the winter to the spring, and was used on imperial festivities, imperial visits, and so on.

sen.j: 桜：表が白で裏が葡萄染（ワインレッド）。
sen.e: Sakura (cherry tree): While the right side is white, the reverse side is ebizome (burgundy or wine red).
sen.cmt: 葡萄染: 用語集には「ebizome (burgundy)」と登録されていますが、本文ではこの後のカッコ内に「ワインレッド」という説明が補足されているため、カッコ内の説明を「burgundy or wine red」としております。
sen.e: Sakura (cherry tree): While the right side is white, the reverse side is ebizome (burgundy or wine red).
Sakura (cherry tree): While the right side is white, the reverse side is ebizome (burgundy or wine red).

sen.j: 春の間着用でき、晴れの席に用いた。
sen.e: It could be put on in the spring, and was used on formal occasions.
It could be put on in the spring, and was used on formal occasions.
It could be put on in the spring, and was used on formal occasions.

sen.j: 葡萄：表が蘇芳で裏が縹（水色）。
sen.e: Ebi (grape): While the right side is suo, the reverse side is hanada (light blue).
Ebi (grape): While the right side is suo, the reverse side is hanada (light blue).
Ebi (grape): While the right side is suo, the reverse side is hanada (light blue).

sen.j: 冬から春まで着用し、春日行幸などの儀式に着用される。
sen.e: It could be put on from the winter to the spring, and was used on ceremonies such as an imperial visit to Kasuga Shrine.
It could be put on from the winter to the spring, and was used on ceremonies such as an imperial visit to Kasuga Shrine.
It could be put on from the winter to the spring, and was used on ceremonies such as an imperial visit to Kasuga Shrine.
